result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel C White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joel C White is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joel C White was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Joel C White was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Mark Lawton

14CF180 & 15CF413, Defendant Joel C White in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In 15CF413, Waiver to Preliminary hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed. Reading waived. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 2&3 in 14CF180 and Ct. 1 in 15CF413. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence in 14CF180, 2 yr. probation, Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. $453 and $253 costs. In 15CF413, 2 yr. probation, $518 costs, complete AODA, submit DNA sample. Ct. 2&3 read in and dismissed.   In 14CF180, count one dismissed. Jail credit: 1 day in each case.
